intro: Agarista duckei, commonly known as the Ducke's agarista, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Agarista duckei is often found in moist, shaded environments within the dense understory of tropical forests.
